hypothesis_content.title: Stablecoin-Denominated Pairs During Stress
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes (VIX > 30 or BTC 10-day volatility > 80%), pairs between crypto assets with high vs. low stablecoin trading volume will exhibit predictable divergence-convergence patterns over 2-day windows.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During market stress, tokens with higher stablecoin liquidity experience less slippage and faster recovery as traders rotate to stable pairs for exit liquidity. The initial panic creates oversold conditions in both, but the higher-liquidity token recovers first as market makers recalibrate.
entry_conditions: Identify token pairs where Token A has >40% of volume in stablecoin pairs, Token B has <20%
Wait for initial 4-hour panic move (both tokens down >15%)
Enter when 4-hour RSI < 25 for both tokens: Long Token A (high stablecoin volume), Short Token B
Equal volatility weighting (target 20% annualized vol for each leg)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Position reaches 5% return OR 24 hours passes
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Token B continues to outperform Token A by additional 8%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of stress events show opposite behavior (low stablecoin volume tokens recover faster) OR average return negative across 10+ stress events since 2020.
